Name: Hollywood
Ingredients: 45 ml Light white rum (charcoal-filtered 1-4 years old)
2.5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
15 ml Egg white (pasteurised) or 																																			Aquafaba (chickpea water)																								 or 3 dashes Fee Brothers Fee Foam cocktail foamer
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker.
Garnish with dusting of nutmeg grated over cocktail.
Review: This drink is deliciously different. Rum, grapefruit, and pomegranate are smoothed with egg white and spiced with nutmeg.
History: Adapted from a recipe in William "Cocktail Bill" Boothby 's 1930 Swallows : World Drinks and How to Prepare Them .
Nutrition: One serving of Hollywood contains 130 calories
